item.description:
Peeptoad Presents: Gypsy Romantique’
November 12, 2010
8:00 pm to 10:00 pm / $15.00 at the door or you can buy tickets online @ this web site.

www.fosteringarts.org


Gypsy Romantique’, whose slogan is: a little Django, a little Tango, a little Swing, A LOT OF FUN!, is just all that. Whimsical and romantic with a lot of the humor infused in Dufresne’s lyrics, the band takes the audience on a magical tour through the jazz and swing era in a brightly wrapped package of new and original material.

Melding the gypsy inspired Paris hot club jazz of the 1930’s and American western swing of the same era.

The base trio consists of John Debossu on bass, Robert Davis , gypsy guitar, and Donna Dufresne, guitar/vocals. The quartet is made complete with the addition of accordion and/or jazz violin which polishes the ambiance of a French Café’ or perhaps a Mexican Cantina ala 1930-something.

will ckeck if dinning is available at the country club and if dinner will be possible.
this is a dinning, mostly light fare, sandwiches, burgers, ckeck the website fostercountryclub.com look at menu and we can decide to go early maybe 5:30 to have a bit to eat. If i dont get enough people interested in dinner prior to event we can just make the concert. Hope this is good never seen them but sounded interesting to me.
